subject: RE: [junit] Plugging performance tests into junit?
msgSnippet: JMeter is cool for some things like testing performance under load of messaging APIs (like, say, HTML or SOAP).  But if you re talking about performance of a
messageBody:
JMeter is cool for some things like testing performance under load of
messaging APIs (like, say, HTML or SOAP). But if you're talking about
performance of a non-messaging Java app, it's probably not what you
need. You should definitely look into JUnitPerf. I used it years ago,
and I don't know if it's JUnit 4 compatible or not. But it was very
cool and lightweight and good for what I needed at the time.

http://clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html


Cheers,
Todd.
